TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Prostějov . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant owns an apartment house in Prostějov .

On DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) granted the applicant ’s action of DATE by which he had requested that the tenancy of PERSON and PERSON , who occupied one of the flats in the house subject to the rent - control scheme , be terminated . The court held that the tenancy would terminate within DATE of the coming into force of the judgment . It ordered the defendants to vacate the flat within DATE of being provided with an alternative flat .

In a judgment of DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) modified the judgment specifying that the alternative flat had to be equivalent to the apartment which they were occupying . The judgment became final on DATE .
On DATE PERSON .

On DATE ORG , upon the applicant ’s request for enforcement of DATE , ordered execution of the judgment of DATE but held at the same time that the alternative flat which the applicant offered was not equivalent since even if it was of a higher category its total surface was PERCENT smaller than PERSON existing flat having CARDINAL room less , was situated on a higher floor and the rent was by CZK CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) higher .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s fresh request for enforcement of DATE , finding that the alternative flat offered by him could not be considered as an equivalent apartment because the rent was by CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) higher than that which PERSON was currently paying for the apartment which was subject to the rent - control scheme . Her financial situation would drastically worsen given that her DATE pension amounted to CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal as being introduced outside the statutory time - limit and upheld ORG decision .
On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) and an appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the decision of ORG and remitted the case to it .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal given that the case was pending before ORG .

On DATE the applicant presented to ORG his complementary submissions and arguments requesting the court to alter the original condition and to declare that the eviction of PERSON should be conditional only on the provision of a shelter ( přístřeší ) .
On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of ORG of DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal on points of law .

In a ruling ( nález ) of DATE ORG , following the applicant ’s new constitutional appeal , quashed ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE and found a violation of the applicant ’s right to judicial protection under LAW ( Listina základních práv a svobod ) . It held that the situation on the flats market at the relevant time made it impossible for the applicant to find an equivalent flat subject to the rent - control scheme . Referring to its ruling no . III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE , the court held that the only duty incumbent on the applicant had been to deploy all his efforts , within the reasonable limits , in order to provide an alternative flat , which , under local conditions and all terms stated in the law , would meet as much as possible the standards of the vacated flat . Otherwise the right of the landlord to terminate the tenancy would become impossible . The ORG could not transfer its duty of social care onto landlords ; owners of flats subject to the rent - control scheme were entitled to obtain the enforcement of an order to vacate under the same conditions as those owning uncontrolled flats . The court also held that a rent only had to be usual for the given place and time .

On DATE ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE , inviting the applicant to submit , not later than at the hearing , documentary evidence that an alternative housing was assured to PERSON It also requested ORG ( domovní správa ) and a number of estate agents in that particular area to provide their opinions on the precognitions for the allocation of flats and on the then current housing situation on the market .

On DATE the applicant filed a claim for damages , under LAW then in LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , to compensate material damage caused by illegal decisions of lower courts and lengthy execution proceedings . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim for damages . In a letter of DATE , the applicant informed ORG of his intention to initiate proceedings before domestic courts . However , there is nothing to show that he did actually turn to a court .

In the mean - time , on DATE , ORG had upheld ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE on the grounds that the applicant ’s request for assignment of a municipal flat had been withdrawn from the register . It appears that the dismissal of the request resulted from PERSON refusal to accept the flat offered by the applicant .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal on points of law against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE as having been filed outside the statutory time - limit .
On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional appeal alleging a violation of his right to judicial protection guaranteed by LAW , but ORG rejected his appeal as manifestly ill - founded on DATE .
On DATE the constitutional jurisdiction rejected the applicant ’s appeal against ORG decision of DATE and the decision of ORG of DATE .
On DATE ORG terminated the enforcement proceedings , PERSON having died on DATE .

On DATE the court evaluated her property to CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) and decided that the inheritance of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) would pass on the ORG . The applicant was paid CZK MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL ) to compensate PERSON outstanding rent from DATE to DATE .

On DATE the applicant brought an action for unjustified enrichment with ORG against PERSON seeking payment of CARDINAL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) which , according to him , corresponded to compensation for the use of the flat from DATE .
In a judgment of DATE ORG dismissed his action , but ORG quashed this judgment on DATE and sent the case back to ORG .

On DATE the latter ordered PERSON to pay CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL plus PERCENT interest to the applicant while rejecting his claim to order PERSON to vacate the flat under the provision by the applicant of a shelter . It admitted that PERSON had failed to meet some of her duties as a tenant , but it held that the alteration suggested by the applicant would be immoral with respect to her age and health .
Law no . DATE on ORG liability for damage caused in the exercise of public authority by an irregularity in a decision or the conduct of proceedings .

Section PERSON ) as in force until DATE provided that the ORG was liable for damage caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings , including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or give a decision within the statutory time - limit . Under section CARDINAL ) a person who had suffered loss on account of such an irregularity was entitled to damages .

On DATE CARDINAL Act no . DATE entered into force amending , inter alia , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) which newly provides that the ORG is liable for damage caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings , including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or give a decision within the statutory time - limit . If the law does not fix a time - limit for these purposes , it is considered that a violation of the duty to perform the act or give the decision within a reasonable time - limit is also considered as an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings . When using the notion of “ reasonable time ” , the LAW refers to ORG and CARDINAL of the Convention .

Act no . DATE also introduced a new section CARDINALa which provides for a reasonable satisfaction for moral prejudice caused by an irregularity in the conduct of proceedings including non - compliance with the obligation to perform an act or to adopt a decision within a reasonable time .
Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that a claim for damages is subject to the DATE statutory bar after the date on which the victim got knowledge of the damage and the authority liable for it .
